quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, origin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: 50% of all Valentines card are purchased 6 days prior to the holiday.
Which saint does not have his/her own island in the Caribbean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Clara

questions.question: Where is the Easter Island located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southeastern Pacific

questions.question: Which country name does not have Christian origin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Verde

questions.question: On which island did Napoleon die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Helena

questions.question: To which country does the term Holy Land refer?
In what decade were the first commercial Valentines cards produced in the United States?
According to the American Greeting Card Association, approximately how many cards are sent out each year on Valentine’s Day?
Which capital city name can be translated as God-given (or Gods gift)?
Which part of the US is known as the Bible Belt?
Which country governs Christmas Island?
This TV tower in Shanghai, China, was designed around a Tang Dynasty poem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oriental Pearl Tower

questions.question: Which saint country is the oldest functioning republic in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Marino

questions.question: Brahma is a Hindu god of creation. What does the name of the river Brahmaputra mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Son of Brahma

questions.question: Which of these rivers is considered sacred in Hinduism?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tower and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, malaysia, ap. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which Danish city was Hans Christian Andersen born?
Legend has it that Martin Luther nailed a copy of his 95 Theses to the door of the Castle Church in this city, thus beginning the Reformation.
Which city houses the oldest Polish university, established in 1364?
Which is the tower located in Toronto, Canada, whose construction was started on February 6, 1973 by the Canadian National Railway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CN Tower

questions.question: The design of which Japanese tower is based on the Eiffel Tower in Paris?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tokyo Tower

questions.question: Which of the following is a tall tower in New Zealand, part of the SKYCITY Auckland casino complex.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sky Tower

questions.question: Which tall tower in Malaysia, built in 1995, is a place for annual races up the stairs to the top?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Menara Kuala Lumpur

questions.question: Which 350-meter tower in Las Vegas, Nevada, is actually a famous hotel and casino?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stratosphere Tower

questions.question: Which city is nicknamed Queen of the Adriatic?
Which Australian tower was previously known as the AP Tower or The Centrepoint?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sydney Tower

questions.question: What is the name of the tower that was built in Kuwait before the Iraqi invasion on August 2, 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liberation Tower

questions.question: Strasbourg is the main city of the Alsace region which is located in this country.
What is the name of the tall tower in Rotterdam, built specially for the 1960 Floriade in the Netherlands?
Which famous Moscow TV and radio tower was designed by Nikolai Nikitin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ostankino Tower

questions.question: In 1991 inhabitants of this Balkan city celebrated after their football club, Crvena Zvezda, won the European Cup.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Pittsburgh
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, parts, enclave. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bangs, Gun Barrel City, Honey Island, Oatmeal, Chocolate Bayeau, Ben Franklin, Cut and Shoot, Ben Hur, Lollipop, Uncertain are cities in this state.
Both versions of the name,  Pittsburgh and Pittsburg are correct.
Which citys name literally means merchants harbour?
In what city is the European Central Bank located?
Pittsburgh is known as three of these alternative names. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quaker City

questions.question: The former name of this city was Breslau and it used to be a major city of south-eastern Germany. It came under Polish administration in 1945. What is its present-day name?
Where are the cities Eros, Vixen, Waterproof,  Ft. Necessity, Cutoff, Plain Dealer, Angie?
Pittsburgh is widely believed to be right behind San Francisco as the steepest city in the United States.
The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra is one of the major orchestras in the United States. It was founded in this year.
Pittsburgh is home to many universities and research facilities. One of them is described here:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carnegie Mellon University

questions.question: Which city was surrounded by an enormous Turkish army in 1683 and was saved by a much smaller multinational army led by the Polish king Jan III Sobieski?
This European capital consists of two parts, which used to be separate cities until 1873.
Roscoe, Bonesteel, Box Elder, Eaglebutte, Red Butte, Crooks are the names of cities in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Dakota

questions.question: Three of these movies are set in Pittsburgh. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Will Hunting (1997)

questions.question: This city, which is an administrative center of a Russian enclave, was once a Prussian city called Königsberg.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, edo. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Communists liked to name cities after their leaders. Which German city was known as Karl Marx Stadt?
Which city was formerly known as Kaapstad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cape Town

questions.question: What was the former name of Istanbul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which port on the Danube river was called Pressburg?
Who gave the current title, The Star-Spangled Banner, to the US anthem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Carr

questions.question: The capital of the Russian enclave located between Poland and Lithuania is called Kaliningrad. What was its former name?
Stalingrad was the scene of an important battle during WW II. What is the name of the city today?
Ho Chi Minh City, the largest city of Vietnam, is widely known under its former name. What was it?
Which European capital was known as Reval?
What is the modern name of Tenochtitlan, the capital of the Aztec civilization?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexico City

questions.question: New York was established by European colonists who named it after the capital of their country. What was the former name of New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Amsterdam

questions.question: What was the name of St. Petersburg in Soviet times?
Edo was an important Japanese city and capital of the Togukawa shogunate. Under what name is it known nowadays?
Francis Scott Key wrote this poem in 1814, which later became the lyrics of the US national anthem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Defence of Fort McHenry

questions.question: In 1885, God Save the Queen was officially adopted as the national anthem of the United Kingdom by Royal Proclamation.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Car and National Anthem
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, subsidiary. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Ferrari Testarossa went into production in 1984. What does Testarossa mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red head

questions.question: French automobile manufacturer Citroen is not very creative. C2, C3, C4.. are not interesting for us. However one of their models bears the name of a famous painter. Which one?
Which car is not WINDY?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Renault MEGANE

questions.question: Which GM model is really a STAR?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Opel ASTRA

questions.question: This actress, writer, talk-show host and comedian performed The Star Spangled Banner before a baseball game in San Diego on July 25, 1990.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roseanne Barr

questions.question: Finish these lyrics of  the US national anthem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: half discloses?

questions.question: In 1931, this president signed a Congressional resolution, by which The Star-Spangled Banner was adopted as the national anthem of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover

questions.question: The National Anthem of Russia was adopted in this year.
What country is this national anthem of?
What do Renaults Clio and Thalia have in common?

options.text: They bear the names of their constructors.
They are produced on the same frame.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both were Greek Muses.

questions.question: The name of this car was also the name of a ship used for the exploration of the New World in the 15th century.
Which of these cars was named after a girl?
SEAT, the subsidiary of the VW group, names car models after Spanish cities or regions. Which is not one of them?
Which General Motors brand name honors a Native American Chief?
This is a translation of the chorus of the national anthem of which country?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Titanic and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sail, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What company owned the Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Star

questions.question: This Philippine president was forced to leave his country in 1986, amidst growing opposition sparked by his fraudulent election.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand Marcos

questions.question: Who was the Captain for the Titanics Maiden voyage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E. J. Smith

questions.question: Which of the following was not a passenger on the Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. Pierpont Morgan

questions.question: The name of which dictator became a catchphrase on the TV show Saturday Night Live during its first season in 1975?
Where was the Titanic built?
Which of the following had the nickname Papa Doc?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francois Duvalier

questions.question: From what harbor did the Titanic set sail?
The Titanic had a total of how many lifeboats?
When was the Titanic launched?
The name of which car can be associated with a DATE?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buick RENDEZVOUS

questions.question: How many people could the Titanic hold fully loaded?
Which of the following Latin American dictators was once courtmartialed for kidnapping and rape?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rafael Trujillo

questions.question: What was the name of the ship that rescued the passengers from the sea after the Titanic hit the iceberg?
What time did the Titanic strike the iceberg?
